summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeGive BackFeeling tired, wired, or uninspired? Bubble can't fix that stuff, but they can make your eyes pop with Morning Rays Brightening Eye Cream! This lightweight eye cream brightens, de-puffs, and reduces the appearance of dark circles for eye-popping results. You may be tired, but you'll look eye-conic.
details: DetailsBenefitsBrightens dark circles.Revitalizes and depuffs tired-looking eyes.Super lightweight texture - somewhere between a serum and a cream.Smooth, never sticky, and non-comedogenic.A quick and easy addition to Step 2 of your routine.Great for use under makeup.Luxurious, premium eye cream experience.Key IngredientsVitamin C brightens the area under your eyes.Turmeric Extract helps decrease the look of dark circles.Peptide/ Acetyl Tetrapeptide-5 helps decrease the look of dark circles.Green Tea Extract helps calm, depuff, and protect skin from environmental stressors.Resveratrol helps reduce redness, brighten tone, and prevent UV damage to the skin.Formulated WithoutDenatured alcoholsParabensAdded fragranceItem 2619861How To UseApply to clean, dry skin (after serum and before moisturizer) by gently tapping cream on under eyes. Use AM and PM.IngredientsWater (Aqua), Glycerin, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Cetearyl Olivate, Niacinamide, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Acetyl Tetrapeptide-5, Anhydroxylitol, Camellia Sinensis Seed Oil, Resveratrol, Butylene Glycol, Xylitylglucoside, Cetearyl Glucoside, Glucose, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sorbitan Olivate, Sorbitan Isostearate, Fraxinus Excelsior Bark Extract, Xylitol, Tocopherol, Silanetriol, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Potassium Citrate, Sodium Hydroxide, Phenoxyethanol.
how_to_use: Apply to clean, dry skin (after serum and before moisturizer) by gently tapping cream on under eyes. Use AM and PM.

reviews.headline: I love this product. Five stars!!!
reviews.comments: The under eye serum is super moisturizing and goes on like a dream. It helps me look confident and i dont even have to wear concealer when i put it on. It is amazing.

reviews.headline: hydrates under eyes!
reviews.comments: i have pretty bad under eye bags so i was really wanting this to work. it doesn't completely eliminate under eye darkness but it definitely covers them enough for days i don't want to wear concealer! the product is also super moisturizing. just make sure you don't rub it in‚Ä¶.just tap it under your eyes with your fingers!

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: It helps my dark under eye circles be morw glowy and less dark.

reviews.headline: Redness and swelling under eye
reviews.comments: I experienced horrible redness, swelling and irritation under my eye where i placed this cream after using it for 24 hours. Not sure which ingredient may have caused this. I have since returned the profuct to Ulta.

reviews.headline: no noticeable results
reviews.comments: I did ample research before landing on this eye cream. The reviews led me to believe I would see results but after over a month of use I see no difference. No bad reactions, it just doesn't live up to the claims/hype.

reviews.headline: My skin burns
reviews.comments:
Wow, this eye cream burns.  And it burns intensely.

I wanted to try this longer to see if it would help reduce my under eye circles but after trying twice, and having to remove the cream due to burns each time, I will just return the product.

The one likeable thing about this product is the texture of the cream. It is thick but goes on smooth.

The worst part, besides the burning sensation, is the pump; push down one time and you have more than enough cream for both eyes.  It is so much that it feels wasteful.

I have sensitive skin and most products with Vitamin C cause my skin to burn.  If you have the same experience with Vitamin C, I would not recommend this product.

reviews.headline: average eye cream
reviews.comments: I don't think this significantly brigthened my undereyes at all. It is quite hydrating, and I liked the thicker texture. However, I did notice it ran out pretty quickly, and I am not a fan of the bulky packaging.

reviews.headline: average eye cream
reviews.comments: I don't think this significantly brigthened my undereyes at all. It is quite hydrating, and I liked the thicker texture. However, I did notice it ran out pretty quickly, and I am not a fan of the bulky packaging.

reviews.headline: I love this product so much.
reviews.comments: Love this product, and would buy it any day. The only con is that it's a little pricey, but other than that, gotta love it!

reviews.headline: Cream OK. Packaging sucks.
reviews.comments: The eye cream itself is fine. I havent noticed any dramatic results but it seems to work OK. However, the green bottle packaging is awful. You cant easily tell how much product is left. The pump doesnt go all the way down into the bottle - not even a little bit. To the point where I thought my bottle was broken when j first got it! I personally would not repurchase this just because of the dispenser.

reviews.headline: Bubble under eye cream
reviews.comments: Came without the straw that goes to the pump and it feels a little sticky. Seems to work though.

reviews.headline: GET IT NOW
reviews.comments: This is the best eye cream I've ever had. I literally scooped to the bottom to get more of it. It is so good. I wake up in my under eyes are completely gone. You have to get it right now!!

reviews.headline: Awesome
reviews.comments: Good product, and I like that you do not need a lot, but the pump you use to get the cream out gives you so much! I end up wasting some almost every time, but nothing wrong with the overall product.

Deceptive container and no results
media.caption: Huge bottle for tiny amount of product

faceoff_positive.comments:
Theres so much RIGHT about this eye cream. Honestly if they made it into a vitamin C facial cream i would use it too. It isnt deceptive like MANY brands are where they put vitamin C halfway down the ingredients list or like the last ingredient making it utterly useless. Its the 4th ingredient, which tells me it is likely at LEAST 5% THD adsorbate but dont quote me on that. This also contains resveratrol which is a super potent antioxidant, some would say comparable to vitamin c.
This also contains Aquaxly which is a compound of several ingredients that give a silky smooth feeling to the skin and hold in water preventing moisture loss. 
Honestly for such a bargain brand im very impressed with this. The texture is also nice and smooth, not oily but also not so dry that when you rub it back and forth that it pills-definitely not this one. 
If i didnt know any better i would swear this was made in korea because the texture is so nice like most korean creams. 
Highly recommend!
faceoff_positive.headline: The ingredients list is phenomenal

faceoff_negative.comments: so I just received this in my ULTA order, and tried it on along with my regular skincare routine. it is a really, really cute bottle at first glance. however, when I tried dispensing the eye cream it would not pump out. i unscrewed the top and saw that the dispensing tube is incredibly short and did not reach the bottom of the bottle. im not sure if mine broke in the bottle or if the tube is normally that short, but it barely picks up any product. i had to flip it upside down and bang it against the table to get product out. i finally was able to dispense it onto the back of my hand after that. it's a lightweight, thin formula with little to no scent. i applied it to my under eyes, eyelids, and orbital bone. when i was massaging the cream in, my right eye started stinging and watering. i will try it a few more times to see if it's just my body getting used to the product, but so far it hasn't been a good first impression. may return it after a few more application attempts.
faceoff_negative.headline: stings eyes and poor packaging
